parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
When, at what time. From the base of pou and te; interrogative adverb, at what time.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
Unbelief, unfaithfulness, distrust. From apistos; faithlessness, i.e. disbelief, or unfaithfulness.
From apo and histemi; to remove, i.e. instigate to revolt; usually to desist, desert, etc.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
